src: a-mu tɕetʰa tɕiʑo kɯnɤ ɕe-tɕi
trs: Mother, you and I will go too.' (2003tWxtsa, 138)

src: nɯʑora ɣɯ nɯ-ɕɤmɯɣdɯ cʰo kɯ-fse nɯ ɯ-tsʰɤt nɯ, tɕiʑo ɣɯ tɕi-tɤɲi tɯ-ldʑa pɯ-tu tɕe, nɯ kɤ-nɯ-tʰɯ-tɕi ɕti wo
trs: Instead of guns and other things like you, we$_{DU.EXCL}$ only had a staff, and we$_{DU.EXCL}$ used it as a bridge (to cross the river).' (2003kunbzang, 164)

src: tɕe rŋgɯ nɯ  to-k-ɤmɯ-rpu-ndʑi-ci tɕe, tɕendɤre ʑɤni pjɤ-nɯ-ɴɢrɯ-ndʑi
trs: The boulders bumped into each other and they were pulverized.' (smanmi4.82-83)

src: aʑo nɯ [a-mu kɯ-me] ŋu-a tɕe tɕe
trs: I am someone who does not have a mother.' (2003Nyimawodzer2, 12)

src: nɤʑo qaɕpa nɤ-rʑaβ ɕɯ kɯ tɯ́-wɣ-mbi
trs: Who will give you a wife, you frog.'   (2002 qaCpa, 15)

src: iʑora <tuhanzu> ra kɯ, <qingyang> tu-ti-nɯ ŋu.
trs: The local Chinese among us call it ``qingyang''.' (20-xsar, 40)

src: ɯtɤz nɯʑo tɕʰi ɯ-rɯɣ tɯ-ŋu-nɯ?
trs: Actually, which type of being are you?' (2003smanmi, 162)

src: a-zda ra ʑara-sɯso tu-nɯ-nɤŋkɯŋke-nɯ ɲɯ-kʰɯ
trs: The other (snakes) can go here and there as they wish.' (The divination, 43)

src: wortɕʰi nɤʑɤ-βra a-tɤ-tɯ-ti ra
trs: It is your turn to say it.' (2014-kWlAG, 90)

src: tɯ-zda pjɯ́-wɣ-z-ɣɤtɕa, \textbf{tɯʑo} ntsɯ pjɯ-kɯ-ʑɣɤ-ɣɤŋgi tɕe, pɯ-kɯ-nɯ-ɣɤtɕa kɯ́nɤ pjɯ-kɯ-ʑɣɤ-ɣɤŋgi tɕe, ɯ-mbrɤzɯ kɯ-tu me tu-kɯ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: If one considers that one's companion is wrong, and always considers himself to be right even if one is wrong, there is can be no good result.' (Mouse and sparrow, 80-82)

src: tɕendɤre tɯʑo tɯ-skɤt ʑara ɣɯ-sɯxɕɤt ɲɯ-ra, ʑara nɯ-skɤt tɯʑo kɯ-sɯxɕɤt ɲɯ-ra
trs: One has to teach them one's language, and they have to teach you their language.'  (150901 tshuBdWnskAt, 29)

src: tɯʑo kɯ tɯ-χti ɲɯ́-wɣ-nɯ-ɕar kɯ-maʁ kɯ,  tɯ-pʰama ra kɯ tɯ-χti ɲɯ-ɕar-nɯ
trs: One could not choose one's spouse, one's parents chose one's spouse.' (14-siblings, 212-213)

src: tɯʑo kɯ tɯʑo tu-kɯ-nɯ-ʑɣɤ-βri ra kɤ-ti ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: One has to protect oneself.' (04-qala1, 25)

src: tɯrme kɯnɤ tú-wɣ-ndza sna.
trs: It is also good for people to eat.' (12-Zmbroko, 31)

src: ɯ-tɯ-mbro nɯnɯ tɯʑo tɯ-fsu jamar tu-zɣɯt cʰa.
trs: As for its size, it can reach one's (a person's) size.' (16-CWrNgo, 18)

src: tɯrme ɯ-fsu jamar tu-βze cʰa.
trs: It can grow about the size of a person.' (12-ndZiNgri, 4)

src: aʑɯɣ 	ndʐa 	ŋu 	ɕi, 	nɤʑɯɣ 	ndʐa 	ŋu, 	aj 	mɯ́j-tso-a
trs: I don't know if it is because of me, or because of you.' (that the phone line is not working well) (phone conversation, 2011) %\wav{8_ndzxa})

src: ``tɕe ɣnɤsqaptɯ-rʑaʁ tu-tsu tɕe ɲɯ-ʁaʁ ŋu" ɲɯ-ti-nɯ ri, aʑɯɣ nɯ ɣnɤsqamnɯz tɤ-rʑaʁ mɤɕtʂa mɯ-nɯ-ʁaʁ.
trs: People say that (chicken eggs) hatch after twenty-one days, mine took twenty-two days to hatch.' (150819 kumpGa)

src: ɯʑɤɣ nɯra tu-nɯ-ɣɤ-βdi tɕe, ɕɯ-sɤ-sqɤr mɤ-ra
trs: He repairs his own (machines) himself, he does not need to ask other people.' (14-siblings, 168)

src: aʑo ɯʑo ʑo kɤ-mto mɯ-pɯ-rɲo-t-a.
trs: I never saw it itself.' (24-kWmu, 7)

src: tɕe lu-nɯ-rɤji-nɯ tɕe, nɯ-kɤ-ndza nɯra ʑara pjɯ-nɯ-tɕɤt-nɯ pjɤ-ŋu tɕe
trs: They planted crops, and earned their food on their own.' (about lepers, who were settled in the special place by the government, 25-khArWm, 70)

src: aʑo raŋ ʑo ju-ɕe-a ra
trs: I have to go there myself.' (150830 afanti-zh, 96)

src: ɯʑo tɕʰi kɯ-ŋu nɯ ko-tso-nɯ tɕe tɕe cʰɤ́-wɣ-tɕɤt
trs: They understood what he was, and expelled him (from their group).' (140427 hanya yu gezi-zh, 19)

src: ɯ-pʰoŋbu tɕʰi kɯ-fse nɯ, ŋotɕu ɯ-sɤz-rɤʑi nɯnɯ ɣɯ kɯ-nɯtsa kɯ-fse ɲɯ-ɕti tɕe
trs: The way its body is like is well-adapted to the place where it lives.' (19-rNamoN, 24)

src: ɕom ɣɟɯ kɯ-mbɯ\redp{}mbro ʑo,  ɯ-ɣmbaj zɯ tɕʰi tu-kɯ-ndɯ ci pɯ-tu ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: There was a huge iron toward, with a tree-trunk stairs on its side.' (Norbzang05, 65)

src: nɤʑo nɤ-mbro nɯ tɕʰi ŋu
trs: Who is your horse?' (about a sentient horse, 2003smanmi-tamu, 53)

src: tɕʰi tɯ-rmi?
trs: What is your name?' (heard in context)

src: tɕendɤre mɤʑɯ tɕʰi ɕku tu
trs: What other (plants of the genus) \textit{Allium} are there?' (07-Cku, 97)

src: ɯtɤz nɯʑo tɕʰi ɯ-rɯɣ tɯ-ŋu-nɯ?
trs: Finally, what race (of being) are you?' (smanmi2003, 172)

src: nɤ-smɤn tɤ-sɯ-βzu-t-a ri maka mɯ́j-pʰɤn, tɕe tɕʰi ʑo tú-wɣ-stu pʰɤn
trs: I had medicine made for you but it does not work, how should we do for it to work?' (nyima wodzer 2002, 22)

src: a-ʁi, ki kɯ-fse tɤjpɣom kɯ-wxti nɯtɕu, kɤ-ɕe tɕʰi tɤ-tɯ-fse-ndʑi?
trs: Sister, how did you cross such a big block of ice?' (Kunbzang 2005, 156)

src: aʑo tɕʰi a-pɯ-ŋu-a?
trs: How can it be me?' (2003sras, 61)

src: tɕe tɕʰi ɯ-spa pɯ-ŋu mɤ-xsi ma tɕe nɯ kɯ-fse pjɤ-tu
trs: It is not known what it was for, but there was something like that.' (hist140522 GJW, 18)

src: tɕʰindʐa ɲɯ-tɯ-ɣɤwu ŋu?
trs: Why are you crying?' (2002 qaCpa, 94)

src: tɕe tɕʰi kɯ tu-sɯ-βze ŋu mɤxsi ma nɯ kɯ-fse nɯ, sɯku ri ku-ndzoʁ ŋu
trs: I don't what it (the wasp) uses to make it (its nest), it is attached on trees.' (26-ndzWrnaR, 55)

src: tu-ɕtʂam-a tɕe tɕʰi jamar ʑo ɣɤʑu kɯ?
trs: I will measure it with a scoop to see how much (gold) there is.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 59)

src: kʰɯtsa ɯ-ŋgɯ tɯ-ci tu-rku-nɯ tɕe, nɯnɯtɕu tɤŋe nɯ pjɯ-sɯ-ntɕʰɤr-nɯ tɕe, tɕe tɕʰi jamar ko-ndza nɯnɯ, nɯnɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯtɕu pjɯ-ru-nɯ tɕe,  nɯnɯ tu-rtoʁ-nɯ pjɤ-ŋgrɤl.
trs: They used to put water in a bowl and let the sunlight reflect into it; they could see how much (of the sun) had been occulted (`eaten' by the eclipse).' (29-mWBZi, 130)

imt: cat \textsc{gen} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-body what \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.long about \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-tail \textsc{dem} also be.long\textsc{fact} but
src: lɯlu ɣɯ tɕe ɯʑo ɯ-pʰoŋbu tɕʰi kɯ-zri jamar ɯ-jme nɯ kɯnɤ zri ri
trs: The cat, its body is about as long as its tail, but...' (27-qartshAz, 219)

src: tɤ-rɟit tɕʰi tɤ-kɯ-sci nɯ ʑo ɣɯ-tɕɤt kɯ-ra pjɤ-ɕti tɕe,
trs: However many children were born, one had to raise them.' (tApAtso kAnWBdaR I, 9)

src: ɯ-rɟit tɕʰi to-sci
trs: Was it a boy or a girl?' (elicited)

src: tɕʰi nɯ-jpum ki ɕaŋtaʁ ɲɯ-jpum mɯ́j-cʰa
trs: As for how thick it can grow, it cannot grow thicker than this.' (16-CWrNgo, 154)

src: tɕʰi tɤ-mbro, ʁnɯ-rtsɤɣ ɕaŋtaʁ tu-mbro mɯ́j-cʰa.
trs: As for how tall it can grow, it cannot grow taller than two stairs.' (07-paXCi, 8)

src: ma-tɯ-nɯqaɟy ma ɕɯ tɯ-ŋu mɤ-xsi
trs: Don't fish, I don't who you are.' (gesar, 369)

src: mɤ-ta-mbi nɤʑo qaɕpa ɕɯ kɯ tɯ́-wɣ-mbi
trs: We won't give her to you, who would give her to you, a frog?'   (2002 qaCpa, 09)

src: ɕɯ ɣɯ ʑo ɲɯ-kʰam-a ra kɯɣe?
trs: Whom should I give (her) to (in marriage)?' (140508 benling gaoqiang de si xiongdi-zh, 222)

src: nɯ nɤ-ku ɯ-tɯ-rɲɟi nɯ, aki ɕe-tɕi tɕe, mbro ɯ-jme cʰonɤ tú-wɣ-sɤfsu, ɕɯ kɯ ɲɯ-zri-ndʑi kɯ
trs: Your hair is very long, let us go downstairs, and compare it with a horse's tail.' (2002 qaCpa, 292)

src: nɤʑo 	tʰɤstɯɣ 	tɯ-kʰɤm?
trs: How much (money) do you give (for it)?' (Bargaining, 13)

src: tsʰupa tʰɤstɯɣ tɯ-tu-nɯ ŋu?
trs: How many (people) are you in the village?' (conversation, 140501)

src: nɤʑo tɤ-rʑaʁ tʰɤstɯɣ jamar tɤ-tsu tɕe kɤ-tɯ-spa-t?
trs: How long did it take you to learn it?' (elicited)

src: tʰɤjtɕu lɤ-tɯ-nɯɣe pɯ-ŋu ra nɤ?
trs: When did you come back home?' (taRrdo conversation, 01)

src: <jipiao> nɯ, tʰɤjtɕu ɣɯ tɤ-tɯ-χtɯ-t?
trs: Your plane ticket, for what date did you buy it?' (conversation, 2014.03.19)

src: nɤ-wɯ kɯ-rɤrɟit jɤ-ari kɯ ɕi, tɤ-tɕɯ cʰɯ-kɯ-rɤrɟit tʰɤjtɕu pjɤ-ŋgrɤl?
trs: (You say) that your father-in-law went away to give birth to a child, since when can a man bear children?' (tAwa kWCqraR, 99)

src: nɤmkʰa ɕɯstɤ-ɟom ku-nɯ-tu kɯɣe?
trs: How many fathoms (high) is the sky?' (tAwa kWCqraR, 106)

src: ŋotɕu ku-tɯ-rɤʑi?
trs: Where are you?' (Conversation, 2005)

src: ŋotɕu tɯ-ɕe?
trs: Where are you going to?' (Common greeting used when one meets someone on the road)

src: qala ŋoj nɯ-ari?
trs: Where did the rabbit go?'  (qala2002, 21)

src: nɯʑɤra ŋotɕu jɤ-tɯ-ɣe-nɯ? ŋotɕu ɕ-pɯ-tɯ-tu-nɯ?
trs: Where are you from? Where have you been?' (2003sras, 57)

src: nɯnɯ ŋotɕu nɤ-jaʁ nɯ-ɣe ŋu, ŋotɕu jɤ-tɯ-ɣɯt?
trs: Where did you get it from, from where did you bring it?' (150831 renshen wawa-zh, 53)

imt: house each \textsc{gen} \textsc{emph} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-mark \textsc{ifr}.\textsc{ipfv}-exist be.\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} where \textsc{dem} be:\textsc{fact}  where \textsc{dem} be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{neg}-\textsc{ifr}.\textsc{ipfv}-be.clear
src: kʰa raŋri ɣɯ ʑo ɯ-ftaʁ pjɤ-tu ɕti ma, tɕe ŋotɕu nɯ ŋu, ŋotɕu nɯ maʁ mɯ-pjɤ-saχsɤl.
trs: There was a mark on each of the houses, and one could not tell which (house) was (Alibaba's) and which was not.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 189-190)

imt: centipede \textsc{dem} sometimes \textsc{aor}-go \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-head \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{caus}-be.first[III] sometimes \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-tail \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{caus}-be.first[III] \textsc{sens}-be:\textsc{aff} \textsc{lnk} where \textsc{dem} \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-head be:\textsc{fact} where \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-head be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{neg}.\textsc{sens}-be.clear
src: qaprɤftsa nɯnɯ, cici jɤ-ari tɕe ɯ-ku ju-z-mɤke, cici tɕe ɯ-jme ju-z-mɤke ɲɯ-ɕti tɕe ŋotɕu nɯ ɯ-ku ŋu, ŋotɕu ɯ-jme ŋu, mɯ́j-saχsɤl
trs: The centipede, when it moves, sometimes its head goes first, sometimes its tail goes first, it is not each to tell which is its head and which is its tail.' (21-qaprAftsa, 12)

src: ŋotɕu tɯrme tɯ-ŋu?
trs: Where are you from?' (2011-05-nyima, 83)

src: aʑo a-wa nɯ ŋotɕu ʑo nɯ ŋu kɯ?
trs: Which one is my father?' (150831 jubaopen-zh, 177)

src: mɤʑɯ ŋotɕu nɯ ʑo sɤndɤɣ mɤ-xsi ma
trs: (Apart from this one), I don't which other (mushrooms) are poisonous.' (23-grWBgrWBftsa, 31)

src: kɯ-me nɯra qʰe me,  ŋotɕu kɯ-tu nɯ qʰe kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn tu-ɬoʁ ŋu.
trs: In (places) where it is not found, there is none, but in (places) where it is found, it grows in great number.' (21-jmAGni, 91)

src: kɯki ŋotɕu ɲɯ-ŋgrɤl?
trs: How could this be possible?'  (qajdoskAt 2002, 32)

src: ɯ-lɤcu nɯtɕu qaʑo kɤtsa ci, ci kɯ kɤ-ntsɣe tʰa-ɣɯt ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: Upstream from there, (there was) a ewe and her young, that someone had brought them to sell.' (2003 kandZislama, 202)

imt: \textsc{ipfv}-treat-\textsc{1sg} be.possible:\textsc{fact} but yet \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-manner some \textsc{ipfv}-exist be.needed:\textsc{fact} \textsc{sfp} \textsc{lnk} something \textsc{emph} \textsc{ipfv}-exist be.needed:\textsc{fact}
src: tu-nɯsman-a jɤɣ ri, mɤʑɯ ɯ-ftɕaka tsuku pjɯ-tu ra wo, tɕe tʰɯtʰɤci ʑo pjɯ-tu ra
trs: I can treat (your illness), but yet another method is needed, something (else) is needed.'  (140427 qala cho kWrtsAg, 48-49)

src: tɕe tɤ-ndʑɯɣ nɯ kɯnɤ, tʰɯci kʰɯtsa kɯ-fse ɯ-ŋgɯ tu-rku-nɯ tɕe
trs: The resin, people put it into something like a bowl.'' (07-tAtho, 44)

src: tɕe mɤʑɯ tʰɯtʰɤci ta-nnɯ-rku-nɯ kɯma
trs: They also probably gave them something else.' (02-deluge2012, 120)

src: tʰɯ-mqlaʁ tʰɯ-mqlaʁ ma tʰɯci fse ci ndʐa cʰɯ-ɕe ɕti
trs: Swallow it, swallow it, it comes down (into your throat) for some reason.' (2005-stod-kunbzang, 87)

src: slama ra ɣɯ tʰɯtʰɤci kɯ-fse, kɤ-rɤ-βzjoz ra ɲɯ-stu mɯ́j-stu-nɯ, nɯ-stu ɲɯ-nɤma-nɯ mɯ́j-nɤma-nɯ,  nɯnɯra nɯ-pʰama ra nɯ-ɕki kɯ-rɤfɕɤt ɲɯ-ra.
trs: One has to tell the parents whatever concerns the students, whether they study seriously and try hard or not.'   (150901 tshuBdWnskAt, 18)

imt: something do[III]:fact-\textsc{1sg} be.needed:\textsc{fact} something do[III]:fact-\textsc{1sg} be.needed:\textsc{fact}
src: tʰɯci nɤme-a ra, mɯci nɤ-me-a ra
trs: I have to do this and that (so I cannot do X).' (elicitation)

src: tɕe kɯ-wɣrum ɯ-ŋgɯz kɯnɤ tʰɯci kɯ-ɤpɣɯlu kɯ-fse ci ŋu tɕe,
trs: (Silver) is white with a little greyish colour.' (30-Com, 176)

src: tsʰitsuku mɯ-to-ti, qʰe tɕendɤre kɯ-rŋgɯ jo-nɯɕe qʰe ko-nɯ-rŋgɯ.
trs: He did not said anything, went back to sleep and laid down in bed.' (150902 qixian-zh, 91)

src: tɕaχkɤr kʰɯtsa nɯ ʁo tʰam qʰe ɕɯmɤɕɯ kɯ ku-nɯ-ntɕʰoz-nɯ ɕti
trs: Now anybody can use tin bowls.' (unlike before, when only important people could use it, 160702 khWtsa, 26)

src: nɯnɯ ciscʰiz ri tú-wɣ-z-nɯndzɯ tɕe ɲɯ́-wɣ-ta.
trs: One puts it vertically somewhere.' (14-tasa, 62)

src: a-pɯwɯ, [ŋotɕu lɤ-tɯ-rŋgɯ ʑo qʰe], nɯtɕu rɤʑi-tɕi ŋu ma,
trs: My donkey, we will stay wherever you lay down.' (28-qAjdoskAt, 38)

src: [tʰɤjtɕu fsaŋ kɤ-ta tɤ-ra] ʑo tɕe nɯnɯ tu-βlɯ-nɯ tɕe,
trs: Whenever there is need to make fumigations, they burn it.' (15-YaBrWG, 31)

src: [tɕʰi kɤ-cʰa] ʑo cʰɯ-pʰɯt-nɯ,
trs: People do whatever they can to remove (this plant).' (12-Zmbroko, 119)

src: lú-wɣ-sti tɕe tɕe nɯ ɯ-ŋgɯ [tɕʰi pɯ-nɯ-ŋɯ\redp{}ŋu] nɯ ɲɯ-mɲɤt mɯ́j-cʰa
trs: One seals (its opening) and whatever (food) is inside will not be spoiled.' (150828 kodAt, 14)

src: [tɕʰi tɤ-tɯ-nɯ-tɯ\redp{}tɯt] ʑo ju-ɣi ɕti
trs: Whatever you say will come.' (2003twxtsa, 117)

src: nɤʑo tɕʰi kɯ-stɯ\redp{}stu-a ʑo ŋu
trs: Whatever you do to me (will be fine).' (28-qAjdoskAt, 40)

imt: tsampa \textsc{dem} Tibetan person \textsc{pl} \textsc{neg}-\textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-like at.all \textsc{emph} not.exist:\textsc{fact} who  \textsc{pst}.\textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{auto}-be \textsc{emph} tsampa \textsc{irr}-\textsc{ipfv}-exist \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{3pl}.\textsc{poss}-\textsc{obj}:\textsc{pcp}-eat \textsc{ipfv}-be.enough be:\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact}
src: tɯsqar nɯ kɯrɯ tɯrme ra mɤ-kɯ-rga maka ʑo me, [ɕɯ pɯ-nɯ-ŋɯ\redp{}ŋu] ʑo, tɯsqar a-pɯ-tu qʰe, tɕendɤre, nɯ-kɤ-ndza tu-rtaʁ ɕti,
trs: Among Tibetan people, everybody likes tsampa (`there is no one who does not like it'), no matter who, if they have tsampa, they have enough to eat.' (2002tWsqar2, 9)

src: tɕe [ɕɯ kɯ pa-nɯ-mtɯ\redp{}mto-nɯ] ʑo kɯki ɣɯ, nɯ-kʰa ɣɯ nɯ-mɯntoʁ nɯ cʰondɤre nɯ-ɕoŋpʰu nɯra tɕe, mɤʑɯ nɯ-<cai> nɯra, pjɯ-ɣɤmɯ-nɯ tɕe,
trs: Whoever saw it, the flowers and the trees and the vegetables of their house, they praised it.' (150824 yuanding-zh, 30)

imt: lady also one-piece apart.from not.exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{2pl} who \textsc{gen} \textsc{aor}-\textsc{auto}-give-\textsc{pst}:\textsc{tr}-\textsc{1sg} \textsc{emph} \textsc{neg}:\textsc{sens}-be.fair be.\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk}
src: tɤɕime ri tɯ-rdoʁ ma me, tɕendɤre nɯʑo [ɕɯ ɣɯ nɯ-nɯ-kʰɯ\redp{}kʰo-t-a] ʑo mɯ́j-nɯtɯtʂaŋ ɕti tɕe,
trs: There is only one princess, and regardless of whom among you all I give her hand to, it will be unfair.' (140508 benling gaoqiang de si xiongdi-zh, 227)

src: [ŋotɕu nɯ́-wɣ-tɯ\redp{}ta] ʑo kɯpɤz ɲɯ-βze ɲɯ-ɕti
trs: Bugs will grow wherever you put (the meat).' (28-kWpAz, 48)

src: kɤsɯfse kɯ ʑo ta-nɯ maʁ
trs: Not everybody puts it.' (160706 thotsi, 21)

src: mɲɯrɯri kɯ `nɯnɯ ɲɯ-pe' ntsɯ to-ti-nɯ
trs: Everybody said `It is nice!'' (140521 huangdi de xinzhuang, 214)

src: ɯʑo tɕʰi kɯra ko-tso
trs: He understood everything.' (2002qajdoskAt, 115)

src: tsuku ɲaʁ, tsuku aqarŋɯrŋe,
trs: Some are black, some are light yellow.' (140505 stonka mWntoR, 5)

src: ci ɣɯ 	tɤ-tɕɯ,  ci ɣɯ tɕʰeme tɯ\redp{}tɤ-tu nɤ, ʁzɤmi ku-kɤ-sɯ-βzu
trs: If one of them has a boy, and the other one has a girl, let us make them husband and wife.' (zrAntCW 5)

src: ci tʰɯ-kɯ-rgɯ\redp{}rgɤz ɲɯ-ɕti tɕe, ci kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi ɲɯ-ɕti tɕe,
trs: One of them has grown very old, and one of them is very small.' (2011-05-nyima, 140)

src: nɯʑora ci kɯ a-tɯci ci ju-tɯ-ɣɯt-nɯ ɯ́-jɤɣ
trs: Could one of you bring me some water?' (150904 zhongli-zh, 51)

imt: \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} again sheep \textsc{dem} \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.black exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.white exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.reddish \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.like exist:\textsc{fact}  \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.blueish exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} each.his.own \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-colour  exist:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk}
src: tɕe nɯnɯ li qaʑo nɯ kɯ-ɲaʁ tu, kɯ-wɣrum tu, kɯ-ɤɣɯnɯɕɯr kɯ-fse tu, kɯ-ɤrŋɯlɯz tu, tɕe nɯnɯ ʑaka ɯ-mdoʁ tu ma
trs: There are black sheep, white ones, reddish ones, blueish ones, each has his own colour (they come in all types of colors).' (05-qaZo, 64-66)

src: li ʑaka nɯ-rmi tu,
trs: Each have their own names.' (150903 tWmNu, 11)

src: ma kɯmaʁ nɯra aj mɯ́j-sɯχsal-a ri, tɤkʰepɣɤtɕɯ nɯ sɯχsal-a
trs: The other ones I don't recognize them, but the \forme{tɤkʰepɣɤtɕɯ} bird, I do recognize it.' (23-scuz, 46)

src: kɯmaʁ/kɯɕte   nɯ-tɯ-ta-t ŋu ɯ-maʁ?
trs: Did you put it somewhere else?' (elicitation)

src: kɯmaʁ/kɯɕte ci nɯ-tɯ-ta-t ŋu ɯ-maʁ?
trs: Did you put something else?' (elicitation)

src: tɕe ci nɯnɯ ju-ɕe ɯ-kʰɯkʰa ci nɯ kɯ ɯ-pu tu-ndze, cʰɯ-rɤɕi.
trs: While one of the two (the prey) is (still) going, the other one (the predator) eats and pulls its intestine.'  (20-RmbroN, 76)

src: ci nɯni ɣɯ nɯ, ndʑi-ta-mar rɟɤɣi pjɤ-ŋu tɕe tɕe nɯnɯ ɯʑo kɯ to-ndza
trs: The tsampa of the other two (sisters) was butter tsampa, and she ate it.' (2003-kWBRa, 20)

src: iɕqʰa ci χsɯm nɯ mɯ-jo-ɣi-nɯ kɯ
trs: The three other ones, without coming, (said...)' (140515 congming de wusui xiaohai-zh, 45)

src: tɯrme ɯ-kʰɤpa zɯ, ki kɯ-fse tɯ-rʑaʁ lu-znɯfsoʁspat-a ku-omdzɯ-a.
trs: I would spend an entire night from dusk till dawn sitting in someone else's animal yard.' (2010-histoire09, 34)

src: li nɯ to-ti ri,
trs: (Gesar) said the same thing to the (snow leopard).' (gesar, 286)

src: ɯ-mu nɯ ku-rqoʁ tɕe ki tu-ste tɕe
trs: It hugs its mother like that.' (19-GzW, 30)

src: kɯki a-slama ŋu
trs: This a (former) student of mine.' (conversation 140510, 17)

src: mɯ\redp{}mɤ-pɯ-jɤɣ tɕe mɤ-ɣi-tɕi ma \textbf{kɯki} \textbf{nɯ} fstɯn-tɕi ra ma tɕi-βɣe ɯ-ku tʰɯ-kɯ-ɣɤrndi
trs: If it is not possible (to take the old man with us) we will not come, as we have to serve him, he is the one who adopted us orphans when we were in dire straits.' (The old man is presumably present when this sentence is uttered; 2003nyima2, 122)

src: nɯnɯ ɯ-mŋu nɯtɕu zɯ li, qapri, nɤki, kɯ-ɲaʁ nɯ kɯ kɯ-wɣrum nɯ ɯ-qiɯ ʑo cʰɤ-mqlaʁ tɕe nɯ pjɤ-rɤʑi-ndʑi.
trs: On the bank (of the lake), there was again a black snake that had swallowed half of a white snake, and they were staying (stuck) like that.' (28-smAnmi, 104)

src: qra nɯ kɯ, mbala na-lɤt nɤ tɕe \textbf{nɤki} ɲɯ-ŋu, jla ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: When a female yak has a young (with a bull), it is..., it is a hybrid yak.' (05-qambrW, 64)

src: tɕe nɯ tɯ-ci ɣɯ ɯ-taʁ nɯnɯtɕu, \textbf{nɤki} ɲɤ-χtɤr, iɕqʰa <yujinxiang> kɤ-ti mɯntoʁ nɯ ɣɯ  ɯ-jwaʁ nɯ ɲɤ-χtɤr.
trs: She spilled on the water...  she spilled the petals of the flower called ``tulip''.' (150818 muzhi guniang-zh, 69)

src: tɕe nɯ-nɯŋa ra nɤki ŋu ɕi, tɕe ɲɯ-tɯ-nɤm qʰe, tɕe ʑara ku-n-nɯ-ɣi-nɯ ŋu ɕi?
trs: And your cows, are they (still) like that, you let them out of the pen (in the morning), and  they come back home on their own (in the evening)?' (taRrdo conversation, 28-29)

src: kʰopi kɯ ɴqiazwɤr ci ɲɯ-mɯm rca ɲɯ-saχaʁ ʑo tɕe \textbf{nɤki} tu-stu-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu ɲɯ-ti, ɲɯ-pʰɯt-nɯ qʰe kɯ-zri... ki jamar ʑo kɯ-zri ɲɯ-pʰɯt-nɯ qʰe nɤki, ɯ-ku ɯ-mtɯ kɯ-fse nɯtɕu kú-wɣ-ndo qʰe tɕe ɯ-pa nɯ, ɯ-jwaʁ nɯ cʰɯ-χɕoʁ-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu...
trs: Kebei says that bitter wormwood is very tasty, and that they prepare it in the following way: they pluck (wormwoods) that are this big, take it by something that looks like a crest on the top, and prune away the leaves under it... (continued by several paragraphs)' (conversation 140510)

src: tɕe nɤki nɯra, mkʰɤrmaŋ ra pjɤ-rɯsɯso-nɯ tɕe,
trs: And these, the people thought about it.' (150829 jidian-zh, 138)

src: aʑo mɯ-pɯ-rɤʑi-a, kɯre pɯ-ɕti-a.
trs: I was not present (there), I was here.' (conversation140510 , 84)

src: aʑo akɯ kɤntɕʰaʁ ri kɤ-ari-a tɕe, nɯ kóʁmɯz kɯre nɯ-nɯ-ɣe-a
trs: I went there on the street, I just came back here.' (conversation, 2013-12-02)

src: βɣɤtu nɯ ɣɯ ɯ-χcɤl ri spoʁ. [...] nɯnɯtɕu tɕe kɤ-ɣndʑɯr ɯ-spa nɯra pjɯ́-wɣ-lɤt.
trs: There is a hole in the middle of the upper grindstone, into which one pours (the grains) that are to be ground.' (160705 khABGa, 14)

src: <qidian> tɕe tɤ-mŋɤm ta-ʑa a-pɯ-ŋu tɕe, tɕe nɯnɯ tɯ-sŋi nɯ tu-mŋɤm, tɯ-rʑaʁ nɯ tu-mŋɤm tɕe, ɯ-fso <qidian> mɤɕtʂa nɯ mɯ́j-ʑi tɕe \textbf{nɯtɕu} tɕe kɯ-xtɕɯ\redp{}xtɕi tɯ-ʑi ɲɯ-ʑe ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe
trs: (For instance), if (the headache) starts at seven o'clock, it hurts for one day and one night, and subsides only in the next day at seven, \textbf{at that time} it starts to subside a little.' (24-pGArtsAG, 93-96)

src: nɯtɕu tɯrme nɯra pɤjkʰu pjɤ-me ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe.
trs: \textbf{At that time} (the time of the dinosaurs), humans did not exist yet.' (180421 bawanglong, 33)

src: tɕeri nɯtɕu kɯnɤ tɕiʑo kɤndʑiβzaŋsa nɯ mɯ-pɯ-nɯ-qia-tɕi
trs: But even in those circumstances (working in different places, and meeting only once a year), we did not lose our friendship.' (12-BzaNsa, 42)

src: iɕqʰa nɤkinɯ <piqiu> nɯ ɯ-rmi kɤ-spa-t-a. nɤki, tsʰuβdɯn ra kɯ rgoŋlu tu-ti-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu. iʑora, tɕe kutɕu tɕe nɯ tu-ti-a ŋu.
trs: I have learned how to say ``ball'', people from Tshobdun call it \forme{rgoŋlu}, we (do not have this word but) this is how I am going to say it here (in this story). (140514 huishuohua de niao, 4)
